elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: Purchasing goods directly from the factory is not always easy for end consumers; it is often made more difficult by so-called supply barriers. Barriers to purchase are conditions that the seller sets for the purchase of a product. What do you understand by the following barriers to purchase?

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Minimum purchase quantity
elements.correctAnswer: The factory does not deliver any goods below a specified minimum quantity.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Small quantity surcharge
elements.correctAnswer: Small quantities of up to a certain number are delivered, but only at a surcharge.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Name one reason why factories often install such reference barriers.
elements.correctAnswer: Factories want to sell in large quantities so that the warehouses are quickly empty again for newly produced goods.
